title: Motivational job application counter app

requirements.text: Create a simple home screen that shows the user’s total number of job applications and provides a primary action to increment the count by 1 each time the user applies.

quotes: I want an app to track and increase the counter for each time i apply to keep me motivated.

acceptanceCriteria: Home screen displays a clearly labeled total applications counter.
A single primary button (e.g., “I applied today” / “Log application”) increments the counter by exactly 1.
Increment action provides immediate visual feedback (counter updates without page reload).

requirements.text: Allow the user to log a lightweight entry for each application (at minimum: date/time; optional fields: company, role, notes) and view recent entries in a list.

quotes: I want an app to track and increase the counter for each time i apply

acceptanceCriteria: User can add an application log entry when incrementing or via an “Add entry” flow.
Recent entries list shows newest-first and includes at least the timestamp.
Total counter equals the number of stored entries (or is kept consistent if stored separately).
User can delete an entry and the total updates accordingly.

requirements.text: Persist the user’s counter and application log entries in the Motoko backend keyed by the signed-in Internet Identity principal so progress is retained across sessions.

quotes: I want an app to track and increase the counter for each time i apply to keep me motivated.

acceptanceCriteria: After refresh/reopen, previously saved counter and entries load correctly for the same signed-in user.
Different principals see different stored data.
Backend exposes query/update methods needed to: fetch stats + entries, add entry, delete entry (and/or recompute stats).

requirements.text: Add lightweight motivation UI elements: show a short encouraging message that changes based on the current count (e.g., 0, 1–4, 5–9, 10+), and a simple milestone indicator (e.g., “Next milestone: 10”).
acceptanceCriteria: Encouraging message text changes when crossing defined count ranges.
UI shows the next milestone target number based on the current count.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) with a calm, supportive look and consistent layout across screens. Do not use a blue/purple-dominant palette.

quotes: i get depressed easily after a few days of trying.

acceptanceCriteria: App uses a consistent, calm visual style across the home counter view and entries list.
Primary action is visually prominent and accessible (clear contrast, readable type).

requirements.text: Add the required generated image asset(s) to the frontend as static files and display the main illustration on the home screen (e.g., header/hero area).

quotes: I want an app to track and increase the counter ... to keep me motivated.

acceptanceCriteria: Generated image files are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Home screen renders the illustration without fetching it from the backend.
Image scales responsively and does not break layout on small screens.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (compose existing UI components instead).
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: No integrations with external job boards (LinkedIn/Indeed) or scraping.
No push notifications, email reminders, or SMS.
No real-time chat or social features.

required: Warm minimal illustration of a person at a desk with a checklist and subtle hopeful elements (job-hunt-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
